Reviews.Title: “Okay but not amazing.”
Reviews.Author: sion3000
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Ayre Hotel. I may have had a more negative view as i let my husband choose the hotel and i wanted another one that was rated 21 on trip advisor out of 500 and was only £10 more than this hotel. First impressions weren't great although the staff when we first arrived were helpful. We had booked a king size room but when my husband asked about having a room with the Sagrada Familia view we were told it would be 30 euros extra per night. I have seen some reviews saying that people were given the room with the view for free. Anyway as we were not willing to pay we were given the option of a king bed with a 'court yard' view or twin beds on the street side. We went for the court yard view which turned out to be a room with no window outside but a window facing out to the foyer. The lights are amazing on the glass in the foyer but the sounds was quite noisy. After a coupe of nights i did get used to it though but did have ear plugs. I also thought it was going to be very light but they did have two sets of blinds, one being black out blinds which have a button so you can just press to open or close. Our room was also a disabled room so we didn't have the fancy shower people talk about. The room was cleaned very thoroughly and we were sure we were given clean towels every day. Personally it didn't bother me that there was no tea or coffee facilities. The bed was very hard but again i didn't mind. The tube station is only 2 minute walk so was easy to get around although we did walk into the centre on our first day which was a pleasant walk but our legs were so tired we decided to get the tube as much as possible after that! We arrived on Bank Holiday Monday and didn't want to go to far to look for our evening meal. There were a lot of cafes but not many restaurants in the area although they could have just been closed as it was a bank holiday. When we did eat here we found it very expensive compared to side streets off Las Ramblas. Obviously this was because of the Sagrada Familia. The roof top terrace views are amazing. They were definitely an amazing plus about the hotel. We were fobbed off about the air con. One day the guy at reception said he could change the temp for the floor and then the next day it was on heat again and we were told by someone else that the temp was on cool in the day but warm in the evening and it seems you can't over ride it in your room. There is a supermarket next door which was very handy to buy water for the room. Overall the hotel was okay just feel it wasn't great. Once i overcame the noisy room i loved Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “good solid hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: magpiejim
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from Barcelona, having spent 4 nights on a pleasure trip. this hotel is a really great option for seeing all of the sights and is 2 minutes walk from Sagrada Famillia metro station. If you are fit and healthy it takes about an hour to walk from the Port or bottom of Las Ramblas back to the hotel. The hotel itself is standard modern, business operation. The rooms are clean and good quality with very firm beds (I liked this, my wife less so) and perfectly adequate for the short amount of time you are likely to spend in the hotel with all of the city to explore. We booked through Easyjet Holidays and the flights plus hotel deal was great value. we had breakfast included in the deal and this is the usual buffet choice which you can really fill up on, I am not sure I would have paid E15 pp for it however when it is easy to get a good 3 course restaurant lunch for E10 almost anywhere in the city. the hotel has a roof terrace with stupendous views of the Sagrada. The roof bar wasn't open when we were there but it is difficult to imagine a better view. All in all, I cant fault this place. Go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Mick and Sue”
Reviews.Author: michael w
Reviews.Content: We had 4 days end of March here very clean great staff very close to all metros making getting around very easy get yourself a Barcelona Card save yourself money on airport transfers metro stop only 1 min from hotel .only downside was no kettle in room for brew but didn't bother us to much .

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Emmanuelle B
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is located about 3 blocks away from the Sagrada Familia Church. It is clean, neat, and quite quaint. The staff is very nice and cooperative. I absolutely LOVED the showers, i would stay in there for a while. The AC/Lighting are all automatic with you inserting your card to turn them on and off. The space is quite comfortable and quite stylish for the price. The only slight drawback was that we had to take a bus or cab to Las Ramblas. The buses stop by every 10 mintutes so if you don't mind that its a good place to stay and i would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and very modern”
Reviews.Author: Drucey2
Reviews.Content: Brilliant central location. Righht next to the Catherdral, lovely rooftop terrace over looking the city. Rooms were modern, clean, bed a bit hard (very european). Staff very helpful and friendly. I had room service one nighht, the food was fresh and good value for money. Great hotel if youo want to explore Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel with Fabalous Views”
Reviews.Author: Portland J
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Hotel Staff Very Friendly and Very Imformative of this beautiful City. The room was of a very high standard. The cleanliness was second to none. The only thing We missed was not having coffee and tea facilities available in the room!. Well located to the Sagrada Familia with great views from The Hotel Terrace. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great designed and modern”
Reviews.Author: noga rahel e Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 4 nights, during a very cold week. the heating was fine, breakfast buffet contained fresh fruits, cakes, breads, egg for your praparation, good but little too expensive, since 12euro is a dinner price at restaurant. notice that you should take the violet metro to SEGRADA FAMILIA, and walk few blocks. there are few super markets and bars nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, helpful - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JouKb
Reviews.Content: Location is very nice, it´s just a few meters of Sagrada Familia, from some rooms you can see it´s towers. It´s a little far from downtown, but there is a metro station very near (Sagrada Familia Station) Staff is very nice and helpful. The hotel is modern, with a great structure. Free internet with wireless in the rooms. The hotel is clean, the rooms are very well equipped and modern. Regarding breakfast, you can buy the full breakfast that is very nice (12 euros if you buy in check) or a mini breakfast in the bar which costs about 3 euros. I really recommend this hotel. The parking costs about 15 euro.

Reviews.Title: “A modern hotel in a nice part of town”
Reviews.Author: iccc
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a modrn design, suitable and clean rooms. The staff is helpful, and a healthy breakfast is offered. Location very near Sagrada Familia is also attractive. Free internet is appreciated (wireless in most rooms). Small minus: The floor in the shower is slippery and even dangerous at the side and near the door.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent Location, Not a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Comman
Reviews.Content: The public areas were very clean and contemporary, reception staff very helpfull and friendly. The room was clean and well laid out. The bathroom (walk in shower not a bath) at first sight was modern and attractive,however on closer examination the areas where the walls met the floor were quite grubby and the shower screen leaked causing the floor to flood whenever the shower was used. The hotel is on a main street and at night the traffic noise madeit difficult to sleep ( more the Spanish use of the horn rather than engine noise). I would question the 4 star status of the Rosellon due to the fact that there is no restaurant. A breakfast room and a bar serving snacks and tapas only. The breakfast was more than adequate (continental buffet) and nicely laid out. A cooked breakfast was available if you requested it from the staff, a fact I learned on morning 3. When I did ask for cooked it arrived promptly and well cooked. All complaints aside the saving grace of this hotel is its location 1 block from the Sagrada Familia and from the roof terrace of the hotel there is a magnificent view of the church from a new angle, also the views of the rest of Barcelona are magnificent. The area around the hotel has many bars and small restaurants and tapas cafes, ideal to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Above average value for money”
Reviews.Author: EricRehovot
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite modern and well maintained (good cleaning services). Service can sometimes be a little bit slow (for example during breakfast there are not enough waiters). The largest inconvenience for us was that we specifically requested an interconnecting room (for parents and two small children) and even though we were told by e-mail there was no problem, when we arrived it turned out there is no such a thing at the hotel. The best solution they provided for us was two adjacent rooms with one common entrance (with a foyer). In addition, the so called free wireless service did not work in our rooms (they told us because these were corner rooms). Staff was polite and friendly, although not very efficient/helpful sometimes. Overally, an above average hotel (not recommend with little children, only older ones) with a decent money for value proposition. Another thing to remember is that beyond breakfast that is served, there is no real restaurant operating in the premises (only a bar with light food/snacks).

Reviews.Title: “Very simple and modest accommodation, hard beds ... Nice staff, great breakfast, clean”
Reviews.Author: Maryjudy
Reviews.Content: Our room was very narrow, with the bed facing a wall ... Bare floors, only one chair in the room, for the desk. The view out the window (of the church) was hard to see unless you were at the desk or standing in front of the window. This hotel would perhaps be fine for younger, sturdier people. We are 60+ and did not find this to be a comfortable place to stay. Beds are quite hard. I would like to commend the staff ... They were very kind and responsive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but.......”
Reviews.Author: stevem1980
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely, a few things did let it down, the lack of double beds (even though our booking was for a double room and not a twin!), we did enquire when we got upto our room and were told that kingsize were available......for an extra payment. The second item was the noise coming through the balcony door, it was like the rubber seal had either not been put on properly or the door had not been fitted correctly. One last thing, no kettle, no milk, all we got were 4 bottles of "complementary" water (2 still, 2 sparking). Should we have wanted more then we would have had to pay for them which was a bit cheeky considering the cost of the hotel. We had some lunch in the bar on the ground floor which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “İncredible Stay”
Reviews.Author: oaltug
Reviews.Content: Situated in one of the best areas of Barcelona and offers rooms with views of the Sagrada Familia. Price / benefit ratio is very good. Easy and convenient transportation from the airport express train with the blue line past 5 minutes' walk from the hotel can be accessed by scrolling to the Sagrada Familia. If you would prefer a taxi in the city very convenient for transportation, such as La Rambla street with a number gidebiliyorsunuz 7 EUR. The quality is very good Terrace Room offers you a fantastic view. Excellent hotel in one word I would recommend it to anyone happy Holidays

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok/good hotel”
Reviews.Author: J M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok, but for a four star hotel I would have expected at least a coffee maker and some cups in the room. There were only 4 small bottles of water in the tiny fridge and the shower gels were refilled only after asking the main desk to tell the maids to do so (along with the latter forgetting to bring fresh towels every day). The receptionists are extremely helpful and they speak English, which is a huge deal in a country that I found difficult to navigate through due to the language problem (the menus were also translated in a very poor English so most of the time I ended up eating something I didn't really order). The beds were good and the sheets very nice. Not too noisy if you kept the window closed. Pay attention to the two sets of blinds, there's a permanent light at the balcony so I went to the reception to ask how I should turn it off - they said there was no way to do that, but there are double blinds so that was ok. Not too many restaurants around, but the biggest plus was the 2 minute-walk to Sagrada Familia and the metro - take the purple line and you're in Placa de Catalunya in 15 minutes tops. I thought it was a little expensive for the quality of the accommodations, but overall the proximity to SF was totally paying off. I did not have breakfast, 15 euros were over the top expensive for the poor choices they had, just go and grab a 1-2 euro croissant and a coffee and you're gonna be better off this way.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PateLisbon
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for a weekend break at Barcelona. Great location: two steps to Sagrada Familia, near by the metro station. Nice breakfast and nice modern rooms, although a little too small. Car parking at the hotel for an extra fee. Free wi fi at the lobby. Nice terrace with a great view to Familia Sagrada!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dechez
Reviews.Content: My 3 girlfriends and I recently spent a day and a half in Barcelona. We stayed at this hotel because it was recommended by our travel agent. It has been recently renovated and the rooms were clean and quite nice with a large window overlooking the street below with a view of the church steeples (Antoni Gaudi's masterpiece). The breakfast was included and had good coffee, espresso, capacino etc... Staff were very helpful and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View”
Reviews.Author: Diamondspc
Reviews.Content: This trip to Spain was a spur of the moment budget trip. Although I didn't want to stay in this area this hotel was on the cheaper end. It was very nice and modern. My room 802 had an excellent view of Sagrada Familia. The staff was very friendly and really helpful. But the hotel had no charm. It was more appearance than a nice homey field. I will have to say Iwas able to see the Mediterranean Sea and i was able to look out and feel peace looking at the church and mountains and the sea. it would not be my 1st choice, but I would stay here again if need be. The area was full of cafes and stores that were nice. The area made me feel like I lived there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: noelleung
Reviews.Content: Cheerful and very helpful and care counter staff Informative map Clean and comfortable room High quality with free wifi and internet provision We, a group of 16 persons, arrived much early than the check-in time with our baggage. The counter staff gave us a room for storage in the basement floor so that we could go to sight seeing in the morning. After that, they extra helped my old mum to carry her big baggage to the ground floor while we were waiting for the room available. We had a very pleasant experience of staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: DianeChayer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Ayre Rosellon Barcelona for a long weekend last month. We had a double room with view on la Sagrada Familia. The room was nice and large (but the mattress was much too hard). The staff at the reception desk was very friendly and helpful. The location was good with a metro station very close to the hotel (2-3 minutes walk). The terrace on the roof was impressive. However, there were a few negative elements. The wireless network was very unstable, although we were not in a corner room (according to the hotel, it’s only in the corners that the network does not work well ). The first morning, the service at breakfast was unacceptable: It was very difficult to get knives and forks (they would even bring your eggs without them!), there weren’t any cups for the coffee, and they would wait until the plates of meat and cheese were completely empty before bringing more food on the buffet. The service was better the other days, but they would still wait until everything is empty before bringing more. A few days after we came back, we found out that the hotel had taken a deposit of 800 Euros when we booked, and yet had taken the full amount when we checked out. I called them and when they found the error, they apologised and reversed the 800 Euros transaction. If the price was lower, I would recommend the hotel anyway because the overall experience was quite OK. But with an average price of 288 Euros (breakfast incl.) per night (in September), my expectations were not really met.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: keno777
Reviews.Content: We visited Barcelona for two days prior to our Mediterranean cruise. This hotel was very well kept and the rooms were super clean and modern with walk in showers. It is only one block from the big cathedral and has many restaurants of all sorts within a block or two. A little grocery store is right next door. The desk clerks have a little problem understanding English, but are very helpful and friendly. We had a private tour of the city directly from the airport on Friday, but on Saturday, I got mugged on the subway. There is a good reason why Trip Advisor rates Barcelona as the number one city for muggings and now I know why first hand. A group of muggers surrounded me and started shouting loudly on the train entry, shoved me on and were off in a matter of seconds. I think it was a Romanian gang but not sure. I was warned, and should have worn a money belt like my wife and aunt and uncle, but was not smart. They got me for about $400. Don't bother to write the mayor. I think they want them to mug travelers since it keeps them off of the locals. Later that day on the Rambalas, another mugger put his hand in my front pocket but there was nothing in there. It is still a great city with a lot to see, but avoid the subway. (The cruise to Italy and Monte Carlo was great by the way). But if you want an nice hotel convient to the cathedral, port and restaurants, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing but good value”
Reviews.Author: PiFi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in early september. We were offered the upgrade to a sagrada famillia view on teh 7th floor for 20 euro a night so we took it as the room was bigger and we were going to be there a while. I personally dont think the view was worth the upgrade on its own but my husband liked it. Put it this way you could clearly see the mid to top of the SG Cathedral from one side but between the room and it were all the backs of the surrounding houses and flats and it wasnt such a great view to say the least. However it would have been a better view than the street one or the internal view. The room was a little shabby and worn around the edges, no mini bar, just free water on the 1st night. the fridge was on though so you could store your own water in there, an advantage in 30 Degrees c heat. The aircon worked very well.There was very little english channel selection on the tv and the reception was bad on those channels. There were no robes or slippers which i would expect for a 4 star hotel and the toilerties were not very nice and in fact i think they refilled them when they looked like they ought to have been individual sealed. i dont have a problem with that if you are honest and just have refillable wall mounted dispensers. My worst gripe is the service and the bed. the bed was rock solid, i had alot of trouble sleeping. The service was generally very poor. The reception staff were extremely unhelpful and unfriendly with the exception of one female receptionist who was nice and helpful but unfortunately was not there often enough. the bar staff werent to be found eaisly after the hours of breakfast, lunch or dinner. On a positive the reception area and bar/cafe area are lovely. there is a terrace which i only went up to during the day, nice views but not really enticing. The hotel should really have a swimming pool. We asked if they had a business centre for printing our boarding pass and we were told no. The female receptionist told us to email the BP to the hotel and they would print it, however when we did that giving the hotel and hours notice the receptionist on duty told us he couldnt find the email so we sent it again and he insisted it hadnt come though. We has adelivery receipt so were a bit put out. Our overriding feeling was he just couldnt be bothered. Location...very very close to metros and the sagrada familia so great from that perspective only 3 stops to passeig de gracia. However the area itself is a bit down/depressed. There are plenty of cafes on a street nearby for breakfast or lunch. Lots of supermarkets within a stones throw as well. We had lunch in the reception cafe once and it was very good no complaints there. We would have eaten there more but just got fed up waiting for staff to turn up to man the bar/cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Comfortable - Well Located. Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: cantwaitformehol
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in this hotel. Lovely & Clean. Beds were a little bit hard, but oddly slept really well. Arrived at the hotel at about 12pm, I had emailed the hotel in advance asking for a room with a window as I heard the single rooms were mostly internal. Well when I got their no rooms were available, they said if I came back by 2pm I could get the room with the window. Sat down in the lobby area to sort out my suitcase and 15mins later the room was ready. Very pleased as I got a room with a view to the Sagrada Familia. Room is a little small but still spacious enough!! Flat screen TV showing quite a few channels in english which was great – I would watch BBC in the mornings whilst getting ready for a day of pounding the streets. Bathroom was lovely & clean – a good size. Shower was amazing (water came from a fixture in the ceiling!!) Used the safe provided and helped myself to the free water provided in the minibar. All the receptionists I encountered (quite a few during my stay) all spoke English quite well – some better than others, but they were all very friendly and accomadating, and answered any questions I had – they also booked my taxi for me from the night before. As others have stated the roof terrace is amazing – a lot bigger than it looks in pictures. Did not eat in the hotel so cannot comment on food or service in the restaurant. The hotel is in a great area, right opposite the Sagrada Familia – lots of shops and restaurants around – supermarket shops and little stores are all within 5mins, as well as local restaurants serving the usual Spanish type foods, they also have mcdonalds, kfc & burger king all within 5mins walking distance if you have a fussy eater or are with children with you. Souvenier shops are also in the immediate area. Metro is literally round the corner. Make sure you come out at the entrance Ave Guadi otherwise you’ll be walking all the way round, but still a lovely walk anyway as you have the church in full view all the time. The one small thing I would say is the Hotel need to provide a better informed handbook for the room – there is no guide for the channels and my main thing was that for my entire stay I didn’t realize their were 2 (electronic) blinds. There is 1 blind down which I never worked out how to pull up – until the last night, when the guy also told me theirs a switch next to the night light which controls the movement of the blinds. I wish I knew that at the beginning so I could get some natural light coming through rather than through the blinds – apart from that though everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous roof top terrace & service”
Reviews.Author: kezza17june
Reviews.Content: The website does not do justice to this hotel. It is modern, clean and the roof top terrace was amazing; directly opposite the Sagrada Familia. What a great place to have a coffee of a glass of wine. There were also lots of great eateries in the area. The staff were very polite and helpful, we had our bags couriered from the cruise ship to the hotel and they were happy to sign for them. If you are planning a trip to the La Sagrada Familia this is the hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Good option”
Reviews.Author: artemis16
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights on business and I found this a very modern hotel. Good, friendly service at reception desk, wi-fi in the rooms. Breakfast is adequate. The room has quite comfortable beds and a desk area. The bathroom was quite large, the shower area is flush with the floor, but it's slightly tilted and drains without any problem. The atrium rooms do not get much light, contrary to what you might expect, since the wall is made of glass (there is a screen for your privacy). The location is 2min away from the Sagrada Familia and the metro, so very convenient. It's quite a good option, I'd consider it if I visited the city again.

Reviews.Title: “Service and help could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: Kaddy255112
Reviews.Content: While in Barcelona we had the misfortune to be robbed in the underground. The young staff on reception were magnificent.... helpful, practical and understanding. We were ashamed our Spanish was rudimentary but the staff were fluent in English and able to assist us. We were accommodated for an extra two days and nothing was too much trouble. We noticed that all guests were greeted in a friendly and warm manner. We can not speak highly enough of the service at this hotel. The breakfast was superb and by booking the previous night a saving was made.

Reviews.Title: “Nice building, crap service”
Reviews.Author: Winus
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel based on some reviews... and they must have had all the good, competent staff during their stay. Where to start... my wife is in the room with my 10 month old (asleep) and housekeeping knocks to ask if the room can be cleaned. The do not disturb sign is in spanish and english... i read it as i put it on... The other sign that is in 2 languages is please clean my room. I'm out all day, come back 4pm... still no clean room. Service at the bar needs to be booked at reception. On 3 seperate occasions (5pm, 3pm and 6.45pm) did i have to walk to reception to ask if anyone was serving the bar. To top it off, the safe was out of battery (took 4 hours to stop the damn beeping) and the sound of the TV stopped working. Safe to say, i won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: diinslc
Reviews.Content: Overall, I can recommend this hotel. The decor is modern, as can be seen from the website. The staff speaks pretty good English. The breakfast is good, a typical European spread. The best thing about the hotel is its location so near La Sagrada Familia, including a lovely view from the rooftop. There are a few cautions, however. The location is great for La Sagrada Familia and is close to metro locations if that is how you plan to get around Barcelona, but other than that, there isn't really anything near to walk to or enjoy. We stayed on a Sunday and were chagrined to find out that since the neighborhood isn't "touristic" most of the good restaurants were closed. That left a choice of tapas restaurants, none of whom took credit cards. This was distressing because it was our last day in Europe and we were running low on Euros in cash. Since the hotel could not provide an exchange, we had to have lunch in the hotel restaurant so we could charge it to the room. (Luckily the food was good and the beer priced right.) We were unable to check in early, but the hotel stored our bags for us while we explored the neighborhood. At 1:30 p.m., they were able to offer a room, but only a choice between an interior room with a King bed or a street-side room with two twins. Since we had pre-paid for the room with Travelocity, I'm not sure if we got the type of room we should have, but did end up choosing the king bed, which was firm and comfortable. Others have commented on not being able to get the room cool enough, but I suspect that may be due to the programming of the thermostat. It was a little tricky to figure out, but once we did, we were able to make the room a very comfortable cool temperature for sleeping. The staff was mostly helpful, but they didn't seem to be very knowledgeable about the area. When we asked for dinner recommendations, they seemed at a loss. Luckily, the hotel offers free wireless internet, so we hopped on Trip Advisor to make some choices. I think the Ayre Rosselon was a good choice for us on this trip, but next time I would choose a hotel with a different location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and we got engaged here!”
Reviews.Author: Gillyrip
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern but traditional enough to offer any traveller a comfortable stay. The hotel is just around the corner from Sagrada Familia (although the grid system can be confusing, so choose your corners wisely!). It's worth asking for a 'view' upgrade for free. They advertise it at €25 but we were lucky enough to stay on a quiet day and got an upgrade free of charge. Yes, the Sagrada is covered in cranes, but it provided a wonderful backdrop for my engagement, so I don't care too much about that. Food and drink wise, head away from this expensive tourist area and try the Born area, at Jaume metro stop on the yellow line. Here you'll find lovely patisseries and street cafes. Back to the hotel anyway. It's very functional, pretty but clinical and has a good array of bathroom miniatures. Perfect for those like us who travel with hand baggage only. The beds are rather firm but hospitable, and the aircon can be noisy, but I found that turning the bathroom lights off helped with this. The roof terrace was the original planned location for the proposal I was told, but a private spanish party meant that it took place in our room instead. Just a cautionary note to anyone out there considering popping the question at this hotel :) the whole moment was lovely, nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful staff, overpriced and just dirty”
Reviews.Author: lavajonation
Reviews.Content: When I first got to the hotel (11am) they told me they had no rooms to check me into and to come back at 12.30 when they might have one available - I came back at 12.30 and waited until 13.30 and they still had nothing for me! When I went back in the evening after sightseeing for the day, they gave me a twin room despite having specifically booked a double for myself and my partner. When I questioned this, I was told it was because they were fully booked but that I could wait in reception the following morning for someone to check out and I might 'hopefully' get a double...but no offers of holding a double for me or letting me know if one came up. Also, room floor was filthy. I walked around barefoot and my feet were black and dusty. Had the room serviced every day but the sheets were not changed once. Bed was hard as a rock. Overpriced for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “very clean, everything brand new”
Reviews.Author: stefan87
Reviews.Content: the room service is great, as we left for a walk in the morning and got back in the evening the room was perfectly cleaned and everything put in place. the breakfast is very good. everything in the rooms and the hotel is brand new, and the building itself has only recently been built. the location is right near the sagrada familia metro station and that's where you also have a bus tour station.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant, comfortable, friendly, fantastic view and great location”
Reviews.Author: JacqyRon
Reviews.Content: First time visitors of Barcelona (and avid city-travellers) we booked this hotel on a friends recommendation. And we have to say: we just loved our stay here. On arrival (and ever after) staff was very helpful and friendly. We took the opportunity (and you should too!) to upgrade to a room on the 8th flour with a SPECTACULAR view of the Sagrada Famiglia. We almost felt we could touch this impressive building. The room is clutterfree and stylish with a large and modern bathroom. The hotel-rooftop is open to all visitors (until 10 pm) and offers a stunning panorama of the city. You can opt for the (fine but quite 'standard') breakfast buffet which isn't cheap at 12 euro's per person, or you can have your breakfast in any of Barcelona's many, many, many eateries. Around the corner you'll find the subway/underground/metro-station (whichever term you prefer) 'Sagrada Famiglia' which gives you access to lines L5 en L2: you'll be downtown (say Plaça de Catalunya) in about 7 to 10 minutes. So this hotels location (quiet sidestreet, Sagrada Famiglia around the corner, easy access to public transport, just a short ride downtown) is a recommendation in itself. If we were pressed to suggest an improvement then we would advise the hotel-management to shut off the exterior lighting on the back of the building after, say, 11 pm: it shines quite brightly into the rooms, possibly disturbing their guests sleep (our there environmental consciousness). Planning to go to Bracelona? We recommend the Ayre Hotel Rosellon!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great, safe location”
Reviews.Author: donfrancis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 days on a 10 day trip to Spain, France and Belgium. This hotel is trying very hard to be cool, and for the most part they succeed. If you've stayed at a W Hotel, it has a similar modern feel to it. The room is very clean, though somewhat narrow. Bathroom was large. Overall it's a minimalist setup. One problem is that they are a little warm and you can't seem to turn the air on or lower the temperature. I would recommend you not pay extra for a Sagrada Familia view. First, while the church is awesome, do you want to pay much more at check in to look at a bunch of cranes working around it? This isn't a view of the Acropolis or the Manhattan skyline. Second, just go to the roof and relax in the outdoor lounge and take in the church for free. Overall, don't expect a great view from your room. The location to the church is fantastic. It's literally around the corner. Overall, the location is nice as the church, a park, a subway station, and several small shops and delis are all on the block. You could probably stay "closer" to more attractions, but you'll probably pay more. The staff is extremely helpful. They booked reservations for us at restaurants, had great suggestions of where to go hang out and eat at night, and were overall very friendly and helpful. The little restaurant in the lobby is ok, nothing special, but not bad. The lobby itself is pretty cool with plenty of areas to sit, relax, use the wifi, plan your next move, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miggins67
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay and would definitely recommend this hotel. We travelled with our 9 year old daughter so had an extra bed in our room, but the room still felt spacious. No noise at all from our room on 2nd floor. Supermarkets , bus, train station and restaurants all very close by. We did pay for breakfast and thought the choice and standard excellent. All staff very friendly and helpful. Overall a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there if you want a single room!”
Reviews.Author: Bilwi043
Reviews.Content: Very trendy, yes, but my room was as lively as tomb. Interior room facing the corridor and lifts through a glass wall, so glasses are blackened and you need to draw the night blinds all day. Apart from that, very small and decorated in black. As you can imagine, you just want to flee from there. And they charge for that tomb without breakfast 138 € per night as best rate no refundable! You have to pay extra money to have a room with a view to Sagrada Familia. I'd have been happy only to have some light. OK, location is good, but in Barcelona public transport works properly and you don't need to stay just around the corner from the Sagrada Familia. Ah, and the worst bed I've slept on in many years. Hotel is average, but too expensive, especially for the room I got.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel right in front of the Sagrada Familia”
Reviews.Author: gda27
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the very doorstep (literally) of the Sagrada Familia. The main doors are not very visible from the street, but they give way to a wide, modern and elegant entrance/lounge bar area. All the staff is young, very kind and willing to help. The room was at the 7th floor, easily reachable thanks to the 2 lifts, nice, comfortable and clean (that was EXACTLY like the advertisement). The view from the big glass window was gorgeous, and with an extra price you can have a room from which you can look at the Sagrada Familia itself. All high quality finishes. We loved both the complimentary Internet connection and 4 bottles of cold water in the minibar. An experience you cannot miss: reach the 9th floor terrace and enjoy the view of the Sagrada Familia while sunbathing!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very good location”
Reviews.Author: MarionEngelschman
Reviews.Content: Had booked different hotel which turned out to be not only very far from the centre but also really noisy. Decided to switch, quickly looked at tripadvisor and found this Ayre hotel. Reception kindly kept 2 rooms for us to choose from when we arrived in a taxi some 30 minutes later. Room was fine, really clean. Only minus; lots of noise from the street (even on our 7th floor), but hey; we were in the centre actually around the corner from the Sagrada Familia so we weren't complaining. Beds were very hard though, so didn't sleep too well the first night. Free Wi-Fi in all the rooms. Great (rain-)shower, little safe in closet and complimentary bottles of water, both flat and with bubbles. Very welcoming . Staff were very pleasant and service-oriented, and all spoke excellent english. Discovery of the roof terrace was a very nice surprise especially with the splendid view of the Sagrada. Also, after walking for hours, it was very nice to relax on the sunbeds on the terrace. As for location; hop-on-hop-off buses also stop just around the corner, great connection with subway. In all; great hotel, very good value for money, I'd definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: tulsacats
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a package so didn't know what to expect. Wonderful . we upgraded to a room that overlooked the Sagrada Familia. They even let us check in early and get a nap before sightseeing. Clean as a whistle. Large bathroom... clean. Staff were so helpful. One drawback.... the bed as as hard as the floor. Niether of us slept well on the concrete like bed, but we did enjoy the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A GOOD CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: GreeceNancy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from beautiful Barcelona ! We stayed for 3 nights at Ayre Rosellon. Our room was on the 2nd floor and I must say that I was a little afraid reading comments about the noise but actually we had no problem at all. Double glass windows and absolutely no problem at all. The room we had at first was cold because there was some problem with the heating in the aircondition. They immediately responded , they send a technician and after a while we were transferred to another room which was fine. Breakfast was good and here is the tip .....If you want hot food like bacon , eggs e.t.c. you have to order them and but that was no problem as the service was very quick. The reception staff was very helpful by giving map, information , direction e.t.c. Location is perfect very close to Sagrada Familia metro station. For me the best part of Barcelona was the gothic quarter where you could walk around , see some street performers , eat delicious tapas and drink wonderful wine.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,tidy,modern,staff helpful”
Reviews.Author: abzee269
Reviews.Content: Arrived and the man at reception was really nice to us. Gave us a map, showed us where the nearest metro was, places to eat etc. Room - Was on the 5th floor. Here it wasn't too noisy. We faced the road, so I can see why others said it was noisy say if you were on the 2nd floor, it would be noisy. The room was really nice, the beds were comfy. They gave you toiletries including a comb :) Location - Metro just around the corner. Also kfc mcdonalds and subway were just around the corner to make you feel at home. The gaudi cathedral is so amazing to look at, and is also just around the corner. We caught the purple metro to the 'las rambas' and the harbour. Food - We had breakfast there everyday. It wasn't the best, but was pleasant. They had fruit, cereal and pastry things. You could order cooked food but they never took your order? You had to approach the staff. I'd stay say here if going to barcelona. Looking at the other hotels and other dodge locations whilst here, this one fitted my list of things I want from a hotel whilst staying away. Room service was quite cheap too! No tea/coffee making facilities in room, but they supply bottles of water in the mini fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not good...”
Reviews.Author: londonmatDE
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and to be honest, there are better 4* hotels at comparable rates in Barcelona. Check-in was friendly but rather slow, no maps or further information offered ( I do speak Spanish quite well, so there's no language problem). Our room facing towards the street was perfecly cleam and has been pointed out before very minimalisic. Sleeping without earplugs impossible; beds are comfortable, however very narrow. Bathroom was all right with an excellent shower, however heating(especially heated mirrors!!!) couldn't be turned off completely, therefore it was very hot. Moreover the a/c in the room didn't work properly either, it seems most guest have a problem with that. Breakfast was ok but nothing really special, service really really slow and omelette which I ordered never appeared. Restaurant was maybe 1/3 full, still nobody came around taking orders for hot items and you had to go and look for staff, however as mentioned before order never arrived... All in all, a nice hotel for a short stay, however there are lots of better 4* hotels such as NH Calderon e.g.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in lovely modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: VickyMcfScotland
Reviews.Content: We thourougly enjoyed our stay at the Rosellon, the hotel is immaculate the rooms are very modern and the staff are very friendly. Its about a 2 minute walk to 2 different Metro lines. Right next to the Gaudi cathedral. Its a great location and not too far out of the city due to the Metro being so handy for and next to the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Take your earplugs - you will need them”
Reviews.Author: Perce11
Reviews.Content: Modern, clean hotel ideally situated with good transport links nearby. Having no water for the best part of a day did cause some problems but beyond hotel's control. However, the level of noise in bedrooms from either the busy main street or the hotel's bar area was not acceptable to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite”
Reviews.Author: mio22_japan
Reviews.Content: I spent a couple of days at the end of November. Actually it was my second time to stay this hotel, but surprisingly, a receptionist remembered me! I'd never had such a lovely experience though I travelled over 20 countries! Besides that, staffs were nice and friendly so I was always feeling comfortable while staying. This hotel is located in a quiet area and I didn't feel it's noisy. I stayed both of exective and regular rooms which were clean and simply designed. Air conditioner didn't work well, but I didn't mind as the temperature was appropriate. It takes about 5min on foot from Sagrada Familia metro station. It's very convenient to go anywhere! From the airport, I took airport bus to Universitat and then changed to metro purple line. The next time I visit Barcelona, I'm sure I will choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetravellingiasi
Reviews.Content: The hotel had very good accommodation condition: large and clean rooms. The breakfast was tasty although with limited options and it was the same every morning for seven days!! It is located near Sagrada Familia and there is an underground station nearby. Unfortunately, the staff was quite indolent and not very sensitive if you asked them something!

Reviews.Title: “Not as far out as it seems thanks to Metro close by...”
Reviews.Author: AmericaninPT
Reviews.Content: Choosing a hotel in Barcelona was difficult. I avoided the noise of the Ramblas and was concerned when I read about street crime elsewhere in the city. This hotel seemed like a good choice and while the area around is mostly residential, we did find places to eat nearby. It is pretty far, meaning not walking distance, from a lot of the sights of Barcelona. So it was something of a compromise. We were able to take the metro easily as there is a station very close by. The Sagrada Familia is around the corner and the view from the rooftop deck of the church is well worth the stay. We felt very safe in this hotel. It wasn't noisy, but our room was stuffy, so we asked to have the window opened and the street noise was then pretty bad. The wi fi worked on and off but not frustratingly so and we did spend some time in the lobby surfing the net as well. We avoided the breakfast buffet because of some of the reviews and were happy with the cafe for coffee and a croisant for 3.50 Euros. I would try other hotels if I were visiting again as this one is pretty pricey, but it wasn't a bad stay and has a lot to offer if price is not the only consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Martrace
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a great location, 5 mins from metro blue line which is really useful. The rooms are as seen in pictures, clean and very comfortable, the walk in showers are wonderful. The view from the roof top decked area is simply stunning. The Breakfasts however... were not our cup of tea, for 12 euro each, fresh fruits and pastries are excellent but the bacon & sausage were not good. A good old full English is not priority in Barcelona. However.... in search of something a little more heartily in the mornings which didnt cost the earth... seek out DINO PAN its a small cafe next to STARBUCKS COFFEE, which is located 10 minute walk from hotel. Walk down passed main entrance to Segrada Familiar and turn right with road.... and your there. It's a give away because locals frequent this little establishment and its easy to see why. We had 2 cappuchino's 1 cup of tea, 2 x hot bacon & cheese baguettes and 1 large savoury pastry for under 8 euro's... an absolute steel. Oh...No tea making facilities, I think it's probably only a sore point with us English.

Reviews.Title: “Good, modern hotel close to Sagrada Familia”
Reviews.Author: FearfulFlyer
Reviews.Content: A newly built and very modern hotel, extremely close to Barcelona's iconic Sagrada Familia cathedral. Ayre Rosellon looked at first glance like a bank - all shiny glass facade, just two minutes' walk from the Sagrada Familia. The reception staff are polite and helpful and speak excellent English plus a handful of other languages by the sound of it. The room was decorated in a very stylish minimalistic way, with a red, black and white colour scheme. Included a safe, minibar, flatscreen TV, built in wardrobes. The bed was a bit hard for my liking. Our room overlooked the busy road of Carrer Rosello which did have a fair bit of traffic going up and down it at all times of night. The bathroom was very large and everything worked well - powerful shower, plenty of hot water at all times. Decent selection of free toiletries provided. Big walk in shower. Everything was spotlessly clean in both bathroom and main room. Breakfast is served on the mezzanine floor above reception. There's a good selection of cold foods including smoked salmon, meats, cheeses, fresh fruits, pastries, and breads, plus a menu of hot items that are ordered from the waiting staff - much nicer than buffet style hot food. There's even cava available. The hotel makes much of its rooftop terrace, which does have great views of the city and the spires of the Sagrada Familia (the latter also visible from the breakfast room). However the restaurant wasn't open when we visited. No explanation was given so we assumed it was due to being low season. There are plenty of good restaurants a short walk away on the Diagonal leading up from the Sagrada Familia, so it wasn't a problem, but maybe should be made more explicit when booking. Overall, a good hotel at a reasonable rate. It worked well as a base for sightseeing, particularly if you are not keen on nightlife and not worried about being away from the main drag of the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, Great location, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: IvanLeafs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem, located a stones throw away from Sagrada Familia. We arrived at 10 am (much earlier than their check-in time of 1:30) but they were good enough to get us a room. At first we were hesitant because the only room they had was on a smoking floor, but there was absolutely no odour in the room. The rooms are stylish, modern and spacious and you may have the good fortune to have a view of Gaudi's masterpiece. The 8th floor terrace is spectacular, bring a bottle of wine up and enjoy the view!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, tasteful and good value.”
Reviews.Author: baloo42
Reviews.Content: This is a really good hotel in a great location. It is less than five minutes walk from the Sagrada Familia and the metro station of the same name so it is very easy to get to all of Barcelona's attractions. There are plenty of restaurants in the area to suit all pockets. However the Rosellon has much more to offer than its location. The whole hotel, including the rooms, is very well furnished in an attractive contemporary style. Barcelona is a city that specialises in rudeness but not the staff of this hotel! From the initial reception to paying the final bill they were friendly, efficient and informative. And to top it all we only paid 67 Euros a night. Some users have suggested asking for Sagrada Familia view rooms. I would question whether it is worth the extra 18 Euros as the rooms on the road are virtually identical and are as quiet as any hotel I have ever been to. If you want to look at the amazing cathedral go up to the roof terrace or walk around the corner. Finally a warning if you are hit by " bird muck" while walking down the street refuse all offers of help by "friendly" locals with bottles of water. The stuff that hit you will be mud and your wallet will be in their pocket very quickly. I know. I fell for it!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Debbie62Hampshire
Reviews.Content: The Ayre Rosellon is an excellent hotel with fantastic breakfasts! It is located just a few minutes walk from La Sagrada Famiglia and with easy access to the Metro for further travel within the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, affordable and close to Sagrada Familia”
Reviews.Author: BabaandDidu
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed at this hotel prior to embarking on a cruise. It was clean, modern, quiet, and a very short walk to Gaudi's Sagrada Familia. The biggest suprise was going to the top floor (a sunning deck) for fantastic views of the church and the city of Barcelona. Free bottles of water were offered for the first night. The only catch was that breakfast was not included in the price. For an all you can eat breakfast buffet it was 15 Euros per person. That seemed pretty standard, but we were not in the mood for a huge breakfast. Other than that, it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Modern Hotel With A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CarlLarson
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the Ayre Hotel Rosellon. It is a clean modern hotel located a block away from La Sagrada Familia. So it is also only a block away from the Sagrada Familia metro stop, making it very conveniently located. It is in a nice neighborhood with groceries and bakeries nearby. Lots of restaurants, both touristy and nice local ones. The rooms are very clean, very modern but typically European small. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I did have issues with the free Wifi. It was down occasionally, but always seemed active at night. The first couple of rooms I was given did not get a clean signal, so I had to change. Also I have now stayed in two Spanish hotels and both have hand linoleum floors, very strange. That combined with a bed that was half on rollers meant it was difficult to sit up in the bed without it sliding around. Small quibbles in what was otherwise and excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views of Sagrada Familia”
Reviews.Author: LAvacations
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ayre Hotel Rosellon for 4 nights in September. They gave us a room on a higher floor with a fantastic view of the Sagrada Familia at no extra charge. The room itself was a bit small but with a big bathroom. The only real problems we had with the room was that the hotel didn't offer the best television channels and we also found little ants in our room on the last night. The workers at reception were friendly and spoke very good english however they weren't as helpful as some of the other hotels we stayed at - they were very vague in their responses to us like when we asked about catching the train to the airport. Also, there was wi-fi in the hotel, but we couldn't get a signal in our room, we had to go out into the hallway to use it. The location of the hotel is great, it steps away from a metro stop and a stone's throw away from one of the most brilliant pieces of architecture in the world - the Sagrada Familia. There are also a number of good restaurants on the Gaudi avenue directly across from the Church. Breakfast is overpriced at the hotel as you can get cheap breakfasts at cafes around the hotel. Overall we enjoyed our stay and probably would come back if it was the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable stay with an unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: iwsdc
Reviews.Content: Our experience of the Ayre Rosellon was very good. The hotel is clean and comfortable (sheets impeccable and crisp, bathroom spotless - our two most important considerations at hotels). Our group consisted of two separate parties and we arrived approximately 4 hours before the scheduled check in time after a long flight from Singapore. The staff speak decent English and were very accommodating, checking us in immediately. We had a double room (the most basic). The bed was comfortable (two singles pushed together) and the room has blockout blinds to eliminate noise and light if that's your thing. The bathroom is large and modern, with a massive shower head and excellent water pressure, which we sorely appreciated after our long flight and the ensuing long hot walks around Barcelona. The hotel is getting a bit shabbier than shown in the photos, but if, like us, you do not intend to spend much time in the hotel and are after a clean and decent room at a reasonable price, this hotel ticks all the boxes. Be sure to request a non-smoking room if required. Our friend was given a smoking room and you can smell the difference. Now, the location. Honestly, if you threw a rock hard enough, you'd hit the Sagrada Familia. Be sure to take a trip up to the rooftop terrace for a breathtaking view, even if you're not a hotel-rooftop-terrace kind of person. It's amazing. The closest metro stop is about 50 metres away. The Passeig de Gracia shopping district is two stops away, and the hotel's stop is also well connected to the lovely El Born area and, of course, La Rambla. The hotel is surrounded by supermarkets and pharmacies (which ended up being more useful than we expected). Other info: the hotel cafe does a good coffee and breakfast and has a pretty decent (though limited) sandwich/focaccia menu for days when you have an early start (Barcelona does not wake up until 10 or 11am). Free wifi in every room (we connected using our own laptop).

Reviews.Title: “Clean Modern hotel close to Sagrada Familia”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug610
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for all attractions by metro! We booked this hotel because of its reviews from trip advisor. The hotel seemed to be very modern. The staff was helpful and a great resource for traveling around the city. We arrived at the hotel early and we were able to check into our room which is extra nice when you have been up early traveling. The reception team was friendly and were all able to speak good English. Our room was on the second floor, view of the street. We didn’t even realize that there was a view of Sagrada Familia until we went down for breakfast the next day. If possible ask for a view of this fabulous work of art. The room was modern and clean and the rainshower shower head was a bonus. As mentioned the hotel is centrally located and closest to the Sagrada Familia and metro stop. Grab a metro map from reception when you arrive and you will be able to run all over Barcelona by way of metro. We ate dinner at one of the cafes close to the hotel with a view of Sagrada Familia. The neighborhood seems pretty safe and walking at night isn’t bad. If you like to have a little fun while seeing the sites, I recommend Fat Tire bike tour too. We did the tour on our first day to give us a bit of an orientation of the city. We had fun and felt that it helped us to get started on our exploring. I love Barcelona and the hotel helped to make my visit great! I recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of A Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty004
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Barcelona several times before and consider this hotel to be an absolute gem. Located in a lovely residential area, it is still within a stones throw of all the attractions and offers an oasis of calm from the bustling streets and searing temperatures of July. If you feet are in need of a rest, there is a metro within 3 minutes walk of the hotel. The hotel is spacious, chic and the staff are very helpful. Upon our arrival we found our room had a small fridge stocked with water. The room was immaculate and cleaned daily. The air conditioning came in very handy especially at night time. We particularly loved the roof terrace on the 8th floor which offers spectacular panoramic views of Barcelona from the Sagrada Familia to the hills near Tibidabo. It is the place to be at sunset with a large glass of wine in hand! We will definitely be back- !Hasta Pronto Hotel Ayre!! Kirsty, Glasgow

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with really friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: flowergirlMidlands
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel, helpful friendly staff. In the Eixample area so quieter than La Ramblas etc but really close to the metro and sagrada familia. There are not as many restaurants and bars in this area but we prefered it a little quieter and it was so easy to travel all over the city by metro. You can purchase a ticket for 10 trips or just 1 from the ticket machines. Hotel was really clean and lots of choice for breakfast including omelettes, scrambled egg on toast as well as the usual continental breakfast. We stayed in an executive room which was larger than expected for a city hotel (with air-con). I am a country girl and didn't think I'd sleep in a city but the glass and the doors were thick so no problem. Two tips for your sightseeing - If you want to see flamenco but don't want to pay over 90 to 120 euros for a show and not very good meal then go to Tarantos at Placa Reial. Shows from 8pm and last about 30 minutes- nothing fancy but they can dance and it costs 8 euros! Sagrada familia - costs 12 euros each to go in but not a lot to see at the moment as only a very small section open. Lift is another 2.5 euros but with a 2 hour queue we decided not to wait. Had we have known we would have saved our money and viewed sagrada from the street. Despite all the comments about robbery in Barcelona, we never saw anything and all the catalonians were really friendly. We got the Aerobus to and from the airport to Placa de Catalunya and then got a taxi to the hotel to save lugging suitcases on the metro - much cheaper than getting a taxi straight from the airport and so easy.

Reviews.Title: “A very hip and trendy hotel - fitting within Barca !”
Reviews.Author: ivy1983
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very good value for money as the rooms were quite spacious, funky in decor and the service was of very good quality. Free wifi was included and I found the staff were very helpful and friendly. Situated right behind the sagrada familia and near many restaurants opened til late, we appreciated the location (had no problems with safety even when it was close to midnight) as it was also within just a few train stations away from most main attractions within the Jaume area. Coming from the airport, we took the airport bus out and got off the Universitat stop whereby we then hopped on a train to get to sagrada familia station. We decided to buy the 3 day train pass which also enables unlimited rides on all of Barcelona's public transportation network for around 15 euros. This turned out to be a good decision as opposed to buying the hop on hop off bus option as Barcelona's public transportation network is in my opinion one of the best in the world and serviced all main attractions (plus, the hop on hop off option finished its runs at 8pm which was actually too early, especially if you want to stay up to watch the opera or view the magic fountain which starts at 9pm). Barcelona's public transportation networks is clean with services running on time and usually every few minutes. Very impressive! We were at first adamant about the general safety in barcelona such as pickpockets etc but we did not experience any issues at all during our stay. Overall, a very pleasant stay at the Ayre rosellon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel good location excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Suz59_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights with grown up daughter who joined me after a business trip to do some sight seeing. Perfect location for all attractions by metro, great view of the Gaudi from our bedroom. Helpful efficient staff, breakfast was ok, they need to provide different serving tools or a different type of machine as we witnessed a German guest who gave herself an electric shock by sticking some metal tongs in the toaster. Other than that very nice bedrooms, good size, big shower, excellent hair dryer.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, clean and cool in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sazb_80
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in May with my Fiance for his birthday which I planned as a surprise so I was a little nervous about what the hotel was like! I had spent HOURS searching for a hotel to stay at, trying to get a balance of good location, price and quality. I need not have worried, it was excellent. It is around the corner from the Sagrada Familiar, less than one minute walk, and with that one of the most central metro stations. I hadn't intended to use the metro, but there is so much to see and do in the city that it was the best option. A did get a few taxis though, and a taxi from the bus station to the hotel was less than 10 Euro. The hotel was really clean, calm and well air conditioned which was a haven from the heat outside. It has a minimilistic look, so don't expect classic traditoinal spanish, but was very comfortable and had everything that we needed. The staff were really friendly and they kindly let us leave our bags for a few hours after we had checked out. When I go back to Barcelona (which I will) I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average..”
Reviews.Author: ribasg3
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days with my g/f. Had requested a double bed in my reservation (3 months ago, when i reserved) but got a twin bed one. Had requested a quite room..instead i encountered noise, so if you go book the rooms with sagrada familia view, and not road view. Room was very small, although bathroom was very nice. Towels not having been changed during our stay (one in particular had the same stain and i kept on noticing if they had changed it...nope). Breakfast is good, not a huge variety but ok. Hotel is new and modern. One more advantage is that it is in a great location, next to the metro. We loved the ease of the location. Good neighborhood. Staff was very polite..but as in all of Spain they should learn to speak better English. Coffee in the cafeteria was great. To conclude i rate it as a 3 star hotel at the most...we went to some other hotels just to look around and realized the hotel asks too much for its money. Book somewhere else or just acknowledge what you get for your money

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with minor flaws.”
Reviews.Author: moolie_loo
Reviews.Content: Checking-in was easy and the young men at the check-in desk were very helpful in introducing the city and places to eat. This is a new hotel so everything that is already there are great--bed, bathroom, windows, view (I could see the Sagrada Familia even though it was covered in construction). As with new hotels, I think they are still trying to work out minor kinks. For example, there was no kettle or coffee maker in the room. For a four star hotel I would think this is a basic requirement. The hotel did provided free water (still and bubbly) in the refrigerator. The other flaw that bugged me was that there was also no business center even though they did provide free wi-fi. The reception offered to print out our boarding passes if we needed to but I was still surprised. There was a really really cheap internet cafe across the street. Location was one or two blocks away from a metro so that made sightseeing easy as well. Overall I would stay at the Ayre again. Like I said, service was great, beds were great, showers were great. Nothing much to complain about other than minor stuff I can live with. For 88 euros a night this was a steal.

HotelInfo.Name: Ayre Hotel Rosellon
HotelInfo.Address: Carrer del Rossello 390, 08025 Barcelona, Spain
